title: New ISAC website
description: Please bookmark the url. Once a stable website is created, the website can be searched from all search engine.

title: Ascension Day
description: Commemorates the ascension of Jesus into heaven. We wish for you to Celebrate hope and new beginnings.

title: Basant Panchami
description: Welcomes spring and the goddess Saraswati. Celebrated with flying kites and yellow attire. We wish for you to Embrace knowledge and creativity, let your dreams take flight.

title: Bodhi Day
description: Marks the day when Siddhartha Gautama, the Buddha, attained enlightenment under the Bodhi tree. Buddhists around the world reflect on the principles of Buddhism: wisdom, kindness, and patience. We wish for you to Seek personal enlightenment, practice mindfulness, and live a life of compassion and wisdom.

title: Children's Day
description: Celebrated on the birthday of India's first Prime Minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, known for his love for children. We wish for you to Honor the rights and education of children, celebrate their innocence and dreams.

title: Christmas
description: Celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ, promoting love, peace, and goodwill. We wish for you to Spread kindness and compassion, embrace the spirit of giving.

title: Diwali
description: Festival of lights, symbolizing the triumph of light over darkness and knowledge over ignorance. We wish for you to Share the light of knowledge, dispel negativity.

title: Durga Puja
description: Honors Goddess Durga, celebrating the triumph of good over evil. We wish for you to Empower yourself and others, fight for justice.

title: Dussehra
description: Celebrates the victory of good over evil, marked by the burning of effigies of Ravana. We wish for you to Stand up for righteousness, conquer inner demons.

title: Easter
description: Celebrates the resurrection of Jesus from the dead. It's the culmination of the Passion of Jesus, preceded by Lent, a 40-day period of fasting, prayer, and penance. We wish for you to Celebrate new life and hope, gather with loved ones, and share the joy of this miraculous event.

title: Eid al-Fitr
description: Islamic festival marking the end of Ramadan, celebrating self-discipline and community. We wish for you to Foster empathy, share blessings with others.

title: Gandhi Jayanti
description: Marks the birthday of Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi, the leader of the Indian independence movement against British rule. We wish for you to Embody the principles of non-violence, truth, and strive for peace and justice.

title: Ganesh Chaturthi
description: Honors Lord Ganesha, the god of wisdom and auspicious beginnings. We wish for you to Remove obstacles, embrace knowledge and wisdom.

title: Good Friday
description: Commemorates the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and his death at Calvary. Christians observe this day with prayer, fasting, and reflection on Jesus' sacrifice for humanity. We wish for you to Reflect on sacrifice and redemption, and find hope in the promise of resurrection.

title: Gudi Padwa
description: Marathi New Year, marking the beginning of spring and celebrating victory. We wish for you to Embrace new beginnings, honor traditions with a modern twist.

title: Guru Nanak Jayanti
description: Celebrates the birth of Guru Nanak, the first Sikh Guru and founder of Sikhism. We wish for you to Reflect on his teachings of love, equality, and social justice; engage in prayer and community service.

title: Guru Purnima
description: Honors spiritual teachers and gurus. We wish for you to Respect and seek knowledge, appreciate guidance.

title: Valentines day
description: Valentines day

title: Holi
description: Festival of colors, celebrating love, forgiveness, and the victory of good over evil. We wish for you to Spread joy and unity, embrace diversity.

title: Islamic New Year
description: Marks the beginning of the Islamic calendar year. We wish for you to Reflect on renewal, commit to good deeds, and celebrate community.

title: Katina Ceremony
description: Offering of new robes to monks at the end of the monsoon season. We wish for you to Practice generosity, gratitude, and support for the monastic community.

title: Laylat al-Qadr
description: Night of Power within Ramadan, considered the holiest night in Islam. We wish for you to Deepen faith, seek forgiveness, and pray for blessings.

title: Lohri
description: Punjabi winter folk festival celebrated primarily by Sikhs and Hindus from the Punjab region. Marks the end of winter and is traditionally associated with the harvest of the rabi crops. We wish for you to Revel in the warmth of fire, celebrate the harvest, and share joy with loved ones.

title: Magha Puja
description: Commemorates the gathering of 1,250 enlightened disciples before the Buddha. We wish for you to Seek harmony, unity, and the teachings of the Buddha.

title: Mahashivratri
description: Honors Lord Shiva, celebrating creation and overcoming temptation. We wish for you to Cultivate inner strength, conquer negative desires.

title: Mahavir Jayanti
description: Celebrates the birthday of Lord Mahavira, the last Jain Tirthankara (spiritual leader). We wish for you to Honor Lord Mahavira's teachings, embrace non-violence and compassion.

title: Makar Sankranti
description: Celebrates the harvest and the beginning of spring. Symbolizes new beginnings and prosperity. We wish for you to Share and cherish the bounty with those less fortunate.

title: Mawlid al-Nabi
description: Celebrates the birthday of Prophet Muhammad. We wish for you to Honor the Prophet's teachings, show compassion, and promote unity.

title: Milad un Nabi
description: Celebrates the birthday of the Islamic Prophet Muhammad. It's observed in the third month of the Islamic calendar. Muslims celebrate this day with prayer, charity, and reflection on the Prophet's life and teachings. We wish for you to Honor the Prophet's legacy of kindness, compassion, and justice.

title: Nag Panchami
description: Traditional worship of snakes or serpents observed by Hindus throughout India. We wish for you to Respect nature and all its creatures, seek blessings for the well-being of your family.

title: Navaratri
description: Nine nights festival celebrating the goddess Durga in her nine forms. It ends with Dussehra, marking the victory of good over evil. We wish for you to Engage in devotion, dance, and festivities; embrace the power of the divine feminine.

title: New Year's Day
description: Celebrated by people around the world to mark the beginning of the new year. It's a time for reflection, resolution, and fresh starts. We wish for you to Embrace new beginnings, set goals for personal growth, and spread happiness and positivity.

title: Onam
description: Kerala harvest festival, celebrating King Mahabali and prosperity. We wish for you to Honor nature's bounty, share prosperity with all.

title: Palm Sunday
description: Celebrates the triumphant entry of Jesus into Jerusalem. We wish for you to Reflect on humility and service.

title: Paryushan Mahaparva
description: Eight-day period of spiritual introspection and fasting. We wish for you to Practice non-violence, forgiveness, and self-purification.

title: Pentecost
description: Celebrates the descent of the Holy Spirit upon the disciples. We wish for you to Embrace inspiration and community.

title: Raksha Bandhan
description: Celebrates the bond between brothers and sisters. Sisters tie a rakhi (sacred thread) on their brothers' wrist, praying for their well-being, and brothers promise to protect their sisters. We wish for you to Strengthen familial bonds, cherish sibling relationships, and share gifts of love.

title: Ram Navami
description: Celebrates the birth of Lord Rama to King Dasharatha and Queen Kausalya in Ayodhya. We wish for you to Embrace righteousness, courage, and the values of dharma in your life.

title: Samvatsari
description: Jain New Year, celebrating the liberation of the first Tirthankara. We wish for you to Reflect on spiritual progress, commit to ahimsa (non-violence), and celebrate new beginnings.

title: Uposatha Days We wish for you to Practice mindfulness, cultivate virtue, and connect with the community.
description: Days of special observance and meditation. Dates vary based on lunar calendar.

title: Vaisakhi
description: Sikh New Year, celebrating the harvest and the founding of the Khalsa. We wish for you to Live with equality, valor, and community spirit.
